headline: 3 Industrials Stocks in the Doghouse
summary: Even if they go mostly unnoticed, industrial businesses are the backbone of our country. But they are at the whim of volatile macroeconomic factors that influence capital spending (like interest rates), and the market seems convinced that demand will slow. Due to this bearish outlook, the industry has tumbled by 7.6% over the past six months. This drop was worse than the S&P 500’s 1.8% loss.
